cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally west, then turning west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast between Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay (near Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mesquite Bay to San Luis Pass TX (south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and upper Texas coast from Baffin Bay northward past Galveston
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible, but the chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds at the port is only 4%. Peak gusts 25–35 mph most likely Saturday afternoon-night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible in Galveston Bay, mainly during high tide Saturday evening.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall totals of 3–5 inches with locally higher amounts could cause ponding on terminals and minor flooding Saturday through early Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby beaches; brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out Saturday night.
